Topic.Title: AMZN earnigs growth required to justify current stock price

Message.Msg: No one seems to care about AMZN's valuation and it's stock keep going up. It has the high PEG ratio in the industry - almost 1.5 times the industry average and it's P/E ratio is also 1.5 timies the industry average. AMZN is no longer the cheapest option for a number of products - Walmart online is often cheaper for common items after considering that both AMZN and WMT charge Sales Tax now. AMZN stock is way overpriced and it isn't worth any more than $100.

Topic.Title: Money coming out of IBM and shoved into AMZN

Message.Msg: You guys do know that both IBM and AMZN are manipulated by the same bad people. They love screwing shorts.

I don't see how you can do anything but go short here, possibly 150 points down after the election and maybe 10-15 points up until the election, and if the kendels don't sell even at cost or a loss look out 85 is possible, not 185....just 85! Hot money leaves as fast as it comes in, the bulls in Amazon always seem to forget that, netflix could drop 20 points, 15 easy in a 1 or 2 day period. I keep telling you same recipe in effect on RENN that they pulled on Bidu, kill the stock over a 2 year period, get all the shares then run it over 100 very quickly so to leave the little guy out!, Watch the oct calls for a triple in Oct priced in on the options!

Topic.Title: 50 down or 30 up, puts are really expensive, whole world looking for major tankage from SCAMAZON!

Message.Msg: Class your right about RENN, the company they were 2 years agow when they launched at 28 are not even close to what they have today. 1.5 Billion in Cash Richest man in the entire country of China now on the RENN board of directors. A groupon site better then groupon. Nuomi online TV site that reaches 285 million viewers, good tv they like is very difficult to see in China, An auction site, An Amazon site, A cell phone videogame site geared towards the newest best smartphones, (they even keep 4 out of the top 20 games constantly on the charts. RENN RENN china facebook but better, growing faster, better mobile technology and 35% logging in and starying on by CELL PHONE, this is huge. And perhaps most telling, they have 9 to 29 year old male and female locked up exclusively to RENN with 5 billion more online users to come online within the next 5 years! And after the handover and change of power, the largest stimulus China has ever seen to jumpstart it and get it back going as well as the global economy. That is before 2012 or 1st week of it, if the new people in their have to talk about maybe going even bigger the the biggest ever, we are at the end of a 3 year slowdown in China and a 3 year downtrend in China stocks, frankly I am excited when Chen and his Billionaire Bulldog says they will not be happy "until RENN has a 100 Billion market cap minimum" He said his company is so underpriced and overlooked by Wall Street he feels insulted, I happen to agree with him! If I told the board how many things I have gone without that I usually blow money on to get more long in Renn then I have any stock in the last 25 years, you would not believe me. I started buying stocks at 12 years old out of newsweek magazine and a fullservice broker, my 1st or second stock was biotechnology group that did not move for years, when it finally did wow. I have plenty of money mainly due to the fact I got in Sina and Bidu at just the right times. I am very short Amazon, instead of losing premiums and watching puts expire worthless for months till the big fall, I have chose to short Amzn and hold it for as long as I possibly can, if the market goes down as much as I think it could, I might cover 90 or 100, course that is with Amazon really screwing up and not just the market correction doing that.

Topic.Title: Money coming out of IBM and shoved into AMZN

Message.Msg: Hi geegenjar, Thanks for the broker info earlier! I'm all set up and ready to start trading tomorrow. :-) But what's this about AMZN and IBM being manipulated?? No stock can be manipulated, it just moves from people buying and selling, right? If some people were changing it themselves it wouldn't be fair to everyone!! ~Jenni
Scamazon has to tack on a $15 ads-free fee to recoup the $ losing Fire HD! The Fire HD is already inferior to Nexus 7. Why would anyone pay a $15 premium for an inferior product?

Nje457 well could be the biggest loser short on this message board. He claims he established his core short position last October when AMZN was around 240. He saw AMZN dive to 170s in December 2011. Didn't take any profit. In January of this year he saw AMZN dive to 160s. He didn't take any profit. Then AMZN started climbing back up. Instead of taking a profit, he started going for scalping on occasional pops making nickels and dimes. But he got caught on 1000-share lot at 196 a few months ago. He doesn't know how to take a small loss, so he's still hanging onto it. Now that AMZN is above $246.11 (last October's high), he's lost all the profit he once had (on paper) on his core-short position as well. He put me on "ignore" a long time ago, so he doesn't answer my question asking how big his core-position is. Can somebody ask him how big his-core position is and also if he has additional shorts he made this year aside from the one made at 196?

Message.Title: Google Chrome commercial on self publishing...
Message.Msg: Awesome. Google's Chrome campaign is getting better all the time. The new commercial has a dad self publishing a Children's book. Whoulda thought that Google might just start coming after Amazon's core business? Unlike Amazon, Google has the cash flow to take this fight to the end... First Target drops Kindle Fire. Then Wal Mart. Then Apple matches eBook pricing. Then Google settles the digital publishing lawsuit (at least with the publishers and the Author's Guild will come soon enought) and then starts marketing self publishing, I almost forgot to mention Oracle getting aggressive about the enterprise cloud... Looks like Amazon is going from bullying mom and pop retailers to being the little fish in a big ocean. Lastly, anyone else notice that while Kindle Paperwhite are 4-6 weeks, Kindle Fire is available for immediate shipping? Maybe, just maybe, Amazon misallocated capital...
